answers.author: Pam Broviak
answers.text:
We outsourced this after many years of doing it in-house. The outsourcing did not cost much more than doing it in-house and now our crews can spend a lot more time in the fall focusing on pavement repairs and forestry operations. And as you suggest, one of the biggest down sides of doing it in-house was the capital and maintenance costs of equipment. Our service provider also has GPS installed on their equipment so our front desk staff can monitor the pickups which helps with phone calls. So, overall the benefits of outsourcing this particular service outweigh any benefits from doing it in-house, at least for our organization.

author: John Mason
text: Looking for innovative solutions in assembling the needed equipment to accomplish leaf collection in a timely manner. We are looking to avoid large capital expenditures on equipment we only use two months per year. Anyone know of any mutual equipment sharing programs that would facilitate this objective?
title: Leaf Collection
